meanings.definition: Unable to be captured or broken into.
meanings.sent1: The fortress was impregnable, with walls so strong no enemy could get through.
meanings.sent2: The castle's impregnable defenses kept the invaders at bay.
meanings.sent3: The impregnable security system made the thieves rethink their plan.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as impregnable as a solid rock.
meanings.sent5: The idea of friendship being impregnable against hardships resonated with her.

meanings.definition: Unable to be defeated or overcome.
meanings.sent1: His confidence in himself was impregnable, leading to his success.
meanings.sent2: The team's impregnable spirit carried them through tough times.
meanings.sent3: The impregnable optimism of the child was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as impregnable as a shield against doubt.
meanings.sent5: The belief in justice being impregnable fueled his fight for equality.

meanings.definition: Unable to be penetrated or entered.
meanings.sent1: The thick fog made the forest seem impregnable, hiding its secrets.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tomb was impregnable, keeping its treasures safe.
meanings.sent3: The impregnable silence of the library was broken only by the turning of pages.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an impregnable fortress, keeping her thoughts private.
meanings.sent5: The mystery surrounding the old mansion was as impregnable as a locked door.
